titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Nicolls Breuckelen patent 1974.149
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:18:28 +0000.

physdesc.extent: in one folder in one oversize box.

did.abstract: Land patent for the town of Breuckelen from 1667, issued by New York Governor Richard Nicolls in an apparent reconfirmation of an earlier Dutch patent.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Richard Nicolls Breuckelen patent, 1974.149, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Nicolls (1624-1672) was the first English colonial governor of New York. He served from 1664, when the English won control of the province from the Dutch, to 1668.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Land patent for the town of Breuckelen, issued by New York Governor Richard Nicolls in an apparent reconfirmation of an earlier Dutch patent. The patent is signed by Nicolls and dated 1667. A typed copy is also included.

controlaccess.subject: Land grants |z New York (State) |z Kings County
